info.title: Fsx for Ontap service API
info.description:
Overview

Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP is a Cloud Manager service that enables you to create, operate, and delete Amazon FSx storage facilities for ONTAP systems.
For more information about FSx for ONTAP, see Cloud Manager FSx ONTAP.

There are four categories of API endpoints defined within the FSx for ONTAP service:

  • AWS operations
  • AWS credentials
  • Working environments
  • FSx ONTAP discovery

References

  • Quick start for FSx for ONTAP
  • Permissions required to create FSx
REST implementation

HTTP methods

Method Description
POST Create an object instance
GET Retrieve an object instance or collection
PUT Update specified properties of existing objects
DELETE Remove an existing object

Request headers

Request Header Description
Authorization Required. Contains a JWT access token
X-Service-Request-Id Request ID to use in logs
x-simulator Indicates whether this API call is simulated or real

Query parameters

You can use query parameters with endpoints in the following components:

Component Query Parameter
isGov - Used to decide whether FSx storage is located in the governed location
region - The API will be executed in the specified region
workspace-id - The Cloud Manager workspace

Path parameters

You can use path parameters with endpoints.

Component Query Parameter
account-id Tenancy account ID for this API
workingEnvironmentId FSx working environment ID used to execute this API

Response headers

This API uses the standard HTTP response headers common with all Cloud Manager APIs. See REST implementation for more information.

HTTP status codes

HTTP Status Code Description
200 OK: Returned for successful operation completion
400 Bad Request: Returned if the input is malformed and could not be parsed
401 Unauthorized: Returned if user authentication failed or the token has expired
403 Forbidden: Returned for authorization errors depending on the resource and token
404 Not Found: Returned if the requested resource could not be found
500 Processing Error: Returned if an error occurs on the server while processing the API call
Error handling

There are three processes involved with error handling and processing:

  • The error is logged for supportability
  • The error is returned to the caller for specific handling
  • The database connection is rolled back
cURL examples

Retrieve FSx working environments for a specified account ID

This cURL example retrieves FSx working environments for a specified account ID.

curl -X GET "https://staging.cloudmanager.cloud.netapp.com/fsx-ontap/working-environments/<accountId>"
 -H  "accept: application/json" -H  "authorization: <user token>"

tags.name: Working Environments
tags.description:
Overview
The working environment endpoints manage operations made on working environments in Cloud Manager.

You can perform the following actions with the working environment endpoints:

  • Create an FSx for ONTAP working environment
  • Retrieve FSx for ONTAP working environments by account
  • Discover an FSx for ONTAP working environment
  • Retrieve volume details for an FSx for ONTAP working environment
  • Retrieve ONTAP credentials for an FSx for ONTAP working environment
  • Create ONTAP credentials for an FSx for ONTAP working environment
  • Recover FSx for ONTAP as a working environment
  • Retrieve details for an FSx for ONTAP working environment
  • Delete an FSx for ONTAP working environment
  • Remove an FSx for ONTAP working environment from a workspace
  • Update the throughput capacity of an FSx for ONTAP working environment

tags.name: AWS Operations
tags.description:
Overview
The AWS operations endpoints manage operations made directly on AWS resources by using AWS credentials.

You can perform the following actions with the AWS operations endpoints:

  • Retrieve AWS VPCs
  • Retrieve AWS route tables
  • Retrieve AWS encryption keys

tags.name: AWS Credentials
tags.description:
Overview
The AWS credentials endpoints interact with the Credentials service to retrieve appropriate AWS credentials.

You can perform the following actions with the AWS credentials endpoints:

  • Retrieve AWS credentials for a Tenancy account
  • [Deprecated] Create AWS credentials

tags.name: FSx ONTAP discovery
tags.description:
Overview
The discovery endpoints provide an API for discovering FSx ONTAP systems for a specified account in Cloud Manager.

You can perform the following actions with the discovery endpoints:

  • Discover an FSx for ONTAP an account

get.description:
Retrieves all the AWS credentials for a specific tenancy account.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

post.description:
DEPRECATED Create AWS Credentials

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

get.description:
Retrieves all working environments of a Cloud Volumes ONTAP instance for a specified account.
You can filter by a specified workspace ID. Pass provider-details parameter to retrieve provider data.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

post.description:
Creates an FSx ONTAP working environment on the required AWS account and region.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

get.description:
Discovers all FSx ONTAP working environments of an AWS region by using specified credentials. 'inDifferentAccount' field in response indicates that a user is already assigned to a different Tenancy account.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Describes all volumes of an FSx system.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves the ONTAP credentials of an FSx system.

Token usage: Cloud Manager service token with the following scopes: occm-access.

post.description:
Creates ONTAP credentials for an FSx system to be used to communicate with an ONTAP FSx file system.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Recovers an unassigned FSx working environment related to a Tenancy account by using the `fsx:assigned` parameter.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

get.description:
Retrieves FSx working environments by specifying the workingEnvironmentId parameter.
Pass provider-details:'true' parameter to get provider data.
Pass `volumes:'true'` parameter to retrieve volumes.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

delete.description:
Deletes an FSx ONTAP working environment.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Removes working environments from a workspace.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

patch.description: Updates the throughput capacity of an FSx for ONTAP working environment.

get.description:
Retrieves all VPCs by region by using the credentials.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves all route tables for a specified region and VPC by using the credentials.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves all encryption keys for a specified region and VPC by using the credentials.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves all supported FSx regions by using the provided credentials.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Discovers all FSx ONTAP file systems. All the relevant AWS regions will be scanned during this operation.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.
